questions.question: Will you please wait here ................................. I come back?
questions.description: Both till and until are possible here.

questions.question: I will come and see you ........................... I can.
I will be in bed ........................ the time you get back.
I will call you ............................. I have the information.
questions.description: Both 'when' and 'as soon as' are possible here.

questions.question: I will be relieved ............................ it is finished.
You have to finish it ........................ you can leave.
I scraped my knee ............................. I was playing football.
I injure myself .............................. I play football.
I will give you the message ............................. I receive it.
questions.description: The expression 'the moment' can mean 'as soon as'.

questions.question: I will be ready when you ..........................
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to refer to future.

questions.question: I will do it only ............................ you pay me.
We stopped playing .............................. it started raining.
questions.description: Because is a conjunction. Because of is a preposition.
